instruction: Read the passage below and answer the question that follows.        Dolphins are regarded as the friendliest creatures in the sea and stories of them helping drowning sailors have been common since Roman times.  The more we learn about dolphins, the more we realize that their society is more complex than people previously imagined. They look after other dolphins when they are ill, care for pregnant mothers and protect the weakest in the community, as we do.         Some scientists have suggested that dolphins have a language but it is much more probable that they communicate with each other without needing words.  Could any of these mammals be more intelligent than man?  Certainly, the most common argument in favour of man�s superiority over them that we can kill them more easily than they can kill us is the least satisfactory.  On the contrary, the more we discover about these remarkable creatures, the less we appear superior when we destroy them.
subTopic: PASSAGE I

The view held by some scientist that Dolphins have a language is

instruction: Read the passage carefully and answer the question that follows.A serious attack on the problem of poverty and intolerable disparities of health demand a change in the whole direction of world economic activity. Instead of maximizing wealth, effort should be directed towards the creation of reasonable standard of living for all people. This applies to the rich and the poor. Nations which are already wealthy have to accept that they are members of the world�s resources but no more. They should not expect to continue to deal with problem of comparative poverty within their own nation at the expense of people abroad who are poorer than their poorest. And the poor nations have to face facts too. They need to stop trying to ape the rich. They have to accept that the closing the gap does not mean and cannot mean attaining for themselves a western style or level of consumption.Adapted from Otuikpe, B. O. et al (2005)Intensive English for Secondary Schools, Book 3, Onitsha; AFP.
subTopic: PASSAGE II

options.option: to embark on more fruitful investment

instruction: Read the following passage carefully and answer the question that follows. Passage I �Biocell�, the new power supply, had a liquid fuel containing tiny forms of life that changed the fuel directly into electric energy. This was for more investing experiment. The biocell is being developed as producer of electricity for radios, for signals to guide ships, for lighting and for other uses. Though the working biocell is only a few years old, some scientists feel that it will one day produce power cheaply as is now being done by other methods, and that the biocell will use materials that would otherwise be considered a waste. Early biocells were powered with sugar but a wide range of fuels can be used. Work is being done using sea water to feed the bacteria.
subTopic: PASSAGE III

instruction: Read the following passage carefully and answer the question that follows.Recent literary researches reveal that Nigerians hardly have time to read. In essence, the reading culture in Nigeria is now at a low ebb. It is disturbing, however, that the few Nigerians that read concentrate more on foreign books than indigenous productions. Most Nigerian authors of novels, storybooks, fictions and non-fiction series have decried, on different occasions, their woes. They were bitter at the way most owners of bookshops and publishers treat them. The question that bothers most Nigerian authors is why are Nigerians not according them such recognition in their own country, while their overseas counterparts are being rewarded with great international honours?
subTopic: Passage IV

items.question: It can be inferred from the passage that

options.option: Nigerians have access to foreign books only
Nigerians do not read international books
Nigerians read foreign and indigenous books alike
